notes.title: Congress of Laibach (1821) & the Vienna/Concert System
notes.content: Locate Laibach (Ljubljana) in the post-Vienna 'Congress System'. Know aims (contain liberal revolts; collective security among the Five) and outcomes (Austrian intervention in Naples). Use for MCQs and short-notes on the Concert's operation/decline.
keyTakeaways: Laibach: Jan–May 1821 in Ljubljana.
Part of the Troppau–Laibach–Verona cycle managing revolutions.
Concert of Europe sought great-power consensus over war.

resources.title: Britannica — Congress of Vienna (context for Congress System)
resources.description: Goals and outcomes of Vienna settlement.

notes.title: Treaty of Paris (1856) — Black Sea Neutralization
notes.content: Know the 'neutralization' clause after the Crimean War: warships forbidden in the Black Sea. Good MCQ material (what body of water? which treaty? year 1856).
keyTakeaways: Article XI neutralized the Black Sea; no warships permitted.
Reversed later by the 1871 London Conference.

resources.title: Treaty of Paris 1856 (English text, PDF)
resources.description: Includes the 'Black Sea is neutralized…' wording.

resources.title: UK Hansard — Treaty of Paris (Black Sea clause quoted)

notes.title: Peace of Amiens (1802)
notes.content: Short-lived peace between Britain and France; date/location = Amiens, March 1802. Appears as factual MCQ.
keyTakeaways: Signed March 25, 1802 at Amiens.
Ended Second Coalition war; truce collapsed by 1803.

notes.title: Tilsit (1807) — Zenith of Napoleon
notes.content: Use Tilsit to argue Napoleon's high-water mark: Franco-Russian alignment; Prussia humbled; Westphalia/Grand Duchy of Warsaw created.
keyTakeaways: Tilsit followed Friedland; France–Russia alignment.
Prussian territory reduced; new client states formed.

resources.title: Treaty between France & Russia at Tilsit (7 July 1807)
Documents upon the Peace of Tilsit (Napoleon-Series)

notes.title: Treaty of Versailles (1919) & League of Nations Covenant
notes.content: Core interwar topic: terms on Germany; mandates; reparations; League Covenant (Articles 10–16 collective security).
keyTakeaways: Cite Covenant Articles directly in critiques.
Frame 'ceasefire for twenty years' argument with enforcement gaps.

resources.title: Avalon Project — Treaty of Versailles (full text)
Avalon — Covenant of the League of Nations
FRUS — Covenant of the League (official text)

notes.title: Treaty of Berlin (1878) & the Eastern Question
notes.content: Revised San Stefano; re-drew Balkans (Bulgaria as autonomous principality; Austro-Hungarian role in Bosnia). Essential for 1878 and Balkan phases to 1914.
keyTakeaways: Know Bulgaria's status; Bosnia's administration.
Use Berlin 1878 as pivot for Eastern Question essays.

resources.title: US FRUS 1878 — Treaty of Berlin (authentic English version notice)

notes.title: Villafranca (1859) & Gastein (1865) — Inter-Italian/German Settlements
notes.content: Villafranca: armistice ending Franco-Austrian war (France–Austria). Gastein: Austro-Prussian partition of Schleswig-Holstein; often noted as disadvantaging Austria.
keyTakeaways: Villafranca (8 July 1859) precedes Zurich treaties.
Gastein sets stage for 1866 Austro-Prussian war.

resources.title: Hansard — Treaty of Villafranca (Commons debate contemporaneous)

notes.title: Declaration of the Rights of Man & of the Citizen (1789)
notes.content: Anchor source for Revolution ideals; appears in MCQs (which constitution prefixed? 1791).
keyTakeaways: Article 1: 'Men are born and remain free and equal in rights.'
Prefixed to the 1791 Constitution.

resources.title: Avalon — Declaration of the Rights of Man (English)

notes.title: Napoleon's Continental System (from 1806)
notes.content: Economic warfare vs Britain; begin with the Berlin Decree; reasons for failure (leaks, smuggling, Iberia/Russia, Continental burdens).
keyTakeaways: Berlin Decree declared British Isles in blockade.
Backfired economically on Europe; spurred conflicts.

resources.title: Napoleon.org — Berlin Decree (article with key articles)

notes.title: Holy Alliance & Metternich
notes.content: Use the Holy Alliance text and Metternich's role in conservative order/restoration; short-note staple.
keyTakeaways: Signed 1815 by Russia, Austria, Prussia (Paris).
Ideological pledge underpinning post-Napoleonic conservatism.

resources.title: Oxford Public Int'l Law — Holy Alliance

notes.title: Italian & German Unifications (Mazzini–Cavour–Garibaldi; Bismarck) + Zollverein
notes.content: Compare leadership/ideals and structural enablers (Zollverein). Tie Gastein/Villafranca to pathways.
keyTakeaways: Zollverein (1834) as economic precursor for German unity.
Cavour's diplomacy vs. Bismarck's realpolitik.

resources.title: Ploeckl (2019) — The Zollverein and the Origins of the Customs Union (PDF)

notes.title: Imperialism Rivals: Fashoda (1898) & Baghdad Railway
notes.content: Illustrate 'New Imperialism' conflicts: Anglo-French Fashoda crisis; German-Ottoman Baghdad Railway and Great-Power suspicion.
keyTakeaways: Fashoda (1898) resolved diplomatically in 1899; symbol of Anglo-French rivalry.
Baghdad Railway concession (1903) led by Deutsche Bank.

resources.title: E-International Relations — Manchuria/Abyssinia & collective security (for imperial failures link)
resources.description: Useful to connect imperial crises to League limits.

resources.title: Cambridge Core — Financial history of the Anatolian & Baghdad railways

notes.title: World War I: Entry & Treaty-Era Transformations
notes.content: Know US entry date (April 1917) & reasons; use primary texts for Wilson's addresses. Connect to postwar map changes and the Chaumont (1814) alliance context for Napoleonic endgame.
keyTakeaways: Wilson asked Congress April 2, 1917; formal war from April 6.
Use FRUS/Avalon for direct quotes in essays.

resources.title: US Office of the Historian — U.S. Entry into WWI

notes.title: League of Nations — Organisation, Failures & Collective Security
notes.content: Use Covenant Articles 10–16 and case studies (Manchuria 1931; Abyssinia 1935) to structure failure analysis.
keyTakeaways: Structural weaknesses + Great-Power self-interest undermined enforcement.
Case studies are essential to scoring well.

resources.title: Avalon — Covenant of the League of Nations

notes.title: Cold War Origins — Kennan's 'X' Article & the Long Telegram
notes.content: Define Containment via Kennan's 1947 'Sources of Soviet Conduct' and 1946 Long Telegram; excellent for Cold War essays/MCQs.
keyTakeaways: 'X' article operationalizes Containment.
Long Telegram frames Soviet motives & policy guidance.

resources.title: National Security Archive — The Long Telegram (original/scan)

notes.title: NATO & Warsaw Pact — Collective Security Blocs
notes.content: Compare treaties (Articles 5 vs 4/defense clauses), membership, and strategic aims; link to European security architecture.
keyTakeaways: NATO Treaty (1949) Article 5 mutual defense.
Warsaw Pact (1955) mirrored bloc alignment until 1991.
